quotes.quote: While wishing and hoping makes you a dreamer, acting and doing makes you someone who can turn dreams into reality.
Wishing does not make a poor man rich.
Great minds have purposes, others have wishes.
A man will sometimes devote all his life to the development of one part of his body - the wishbone.
A wish is a desire without an attempt.
Wishing consumes as much energy as planning.
You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water. Don't let yourself indulge in vain wishes.
Many of us spend half of our time wishing for things we could have if we didn't spend half our time wishing.
Wishes won't wash dishes.
Work while others are wishing.
If wishes were horses beggars would ride.
The wishing gate opens into nothing.
Wishing of all strategies, is the worst.
Work will win when wishy washy wishing won't.
To a resolute mind, wishing to do is the first step toward doing. But if we do not wish to do a thing it becomes impossible.
I don't believe that wishing works. I think we get the things we work for.
Wishing of all employments is the worst.
Wishing of all strategies, is the worst.
A man, when he wishes, is the master of his fate.
My only wish is that my wishes be at rest.
Some people develop a wishbone where their backbone should be.
We are never further from what we wish than when we believe that we have what we wished for.
When we get to wishing a great deal for ourselves, whatever we get soon turns into mere limitation and exclusion.
We would often be sorry if our wishes were granted.
For adults, wishing is a sign of thinking something is not possible.
Don't waste too much time wishing, hoping, and being envious; it'll make you bugnutty.
Wanting and wishing are very different.
Wishing for something without tirelessly working for it, is like trying to drive a car that has no fuel in it.
I don't have the time to wish for the things that I positively desire in life because I am always busy working to attain them.
The habit of wishing is only for those who aren't hungry enough for success.
